channel.title: Play a server off two computers in the same house
channel.description: Me and my brother can both code decently well, but we want to be able to play with eachother on the server. ( we both be on in the same house, two different computers) How would we go about doing this? We have tried a few different ways, im not sure if we can host or not, so putting the server online to play with eachother is not a option i dont think...Would it work by connecting a ethernet cord to each computer? Please help me. Thankyou for your time.

item.title: Play a server off two computers in the same house
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

What I do is just put my server online and let whoever wants on on the server and play.

Read full topic

item.title: Play a server off two computers in the same house
item.dc:creator: @Kidage Kidage
item.description:
@Kidage wrote:

Just use 127.0.0.1 if you’re going to play on your home connection.

item.title: Play a server off two computers in the same house
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

deathschaos9:

Since you’re both connected to the same router, you wont need to port forward.

If. Theres a very very slim line that they aren’t.

Read full topic

@deathschaos9 wrote:

Since you’re both connected to the same router, you wont need to port forward.

item.source: Play a server off two computers in the same house

item.title: Play a server off two computers in the same house
item.dc:creator: @pk2play pk2play
item.description:
@pk2play wrote:

[quote=“Coelho, post:4, topic:396575”][quote author=pk2play link=topic=493747.msg3609887#msg3609887 date=1306463599]

If you’re sharing an internet connection, you can normally connect using the hosting computer’s IPv4 address as the server IP.

Would you have to port forward for this?
[/quote]
If you are connected through a router (which is what I think he is talking about) no, but if you are just connected through the internet then yes.

(Wow that made no sense, but you get what I mean… [Hopefully])[/quote]
Yeah that made no sense at all.

Read full topic
item.source: Play a server off two computers in the same house

item.title: Play a server off two computers in the same house

If you’re sharing an internet connection, you can normally connect using the hosting computer’s IPv4 address as the server IP.
[/quote]

Would you have to port forward for this?[/quote]
If you are connected through a router (which is what I think he is talking about) no, but if you are just connected through the internet then yes.

(Wow that made no sense, but you get what I mean… [Hopefully])

Read full topic
